title: This assignment tests you on how to use if else statements when you want to make decisions in the program.

questionText.text:
Given 2 int values, return true if either of them is in the range 10..20 inclusive.
n1020(12, 99) → true
in1020(21, 12) → true
in1020(8, 99) → false
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This assignment tests you on how to use if else statements when you want to make decisions in the program.

questionText.text:
Write a java program to find whether the given year is Leap Year or not
isLeapYear(2016) → true
isLeapYear(2019) → false
isLeapYear(2000) → true
isLeapYear(2100) → false
in1020(8, 99) → false
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This assignment tests you on how to use if else statements when you want to make decisions in the program.

questionText.text:
Write a program that displays the name of the day, based on the value of the day, using the switch statement.
displayNameOfDay(1) → Monday
displayNameOfDay(5) → Friday
displayNameOfDay(25) → Invalid input! Week number should be in between 1-7.
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This assignment tests you on how to use if else statements when you want to make decisions in the program.

questionText.text:
We have a loud talking parrot. The "hour" parameter is the current hour time in the range 0..23. We are in trouble if the parrot is talking and the hour is before 7 or after 20. Return true if we are in trouble.
parrotTrouble(true, 6) → true
parrotTrouble(true, 7) → false
parrotTrouble(false, 6) → false
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed
